page.title: 06FARM METHODS
page.content: The majority of farms on the Ards Penninsula are large enough to support mechanisation.Farmers are able to purchase and employ specialised machinery which reduces the amount of labour needed to do most of the jobs on the farm.There are machines,most of them drawn by diesel powered tractors which cut grass and automatically load it onto tralers for making into silage The tractors are very versatile and have many attachments such as seed planters,ploughs,potato harvesters, sprayers and many other specialist equipment either hydraullically operated or driven from the Power Take Off.
